triplets: Insect with brightly colored wings, belonging to the order Lepidoptera, known for metamorphosis from caterpillar to adult
Wildlife viewing, ecological studies, pollination, and aesthetic appreciation in gardens and nature reserves
Exoskeleton made of chitin, wings covered with scales
Varies widely depending on species; includes combinations of orange, yellow, black, white, blue, and metallic hues
Ecosystems as pollinators and part of the food chain
Varies; wingspan usually 2–12 cm depending on species
1–2 weeks on average for adult butterflies; full life cycle (egg to adult) can range from 1 month to several months depending on species
